channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: US Feds put together ‘FTX task force’ to trace stolen user funds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: United States Attorney Damian Williams said the office is working “around the clock” to respond to the implosion of FTX.

item.title: Core Scientific shuts down 37K mining rigs it was hosting for Celsius
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Core Scientific estimates that canceling the agreement with Celsius will provide $2 million in revenue per month as long as Bitcoin stays around $16,700.

item.title: Ripple CEO optimistic about US ‘regulatory clarity for crypto’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Support for cryptocurrency regulation in the United States is “bipartisan & bicameral,” according to Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse.

item.title: Crypto adoption in 2022: What events moved the industry forward?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shiraz Jagati
item.description: While the crypto market in 2022 was hit by a slew of insolvencies and daily volatility, adoption seems to have continued apace on the global level.

item.title: Users need to go under the engine in Web3 — HashEx CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Erhan Kahraman
item.description: HashEx CEO Dmitry Mishunin summarizes Web3 as read, write, own — a “crazy responsibility” for the end-user.

item.title: US federal agencies release joint statement on crypto asset risks and safe practices
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Fed, FDIC and OCC teamed up to wish the banks they regulate a FUD-filled new year with a warning about the risks associated with crypto assets and their efforts to contain those risks.

item.title: Cryptosat launches second ‘cryptographically-equipped’ satellite using SpaceX rocket
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The addition to the satellite constellation was part of efforts to make space a “new battleground in the quest for bulletproof cryptography” by expanding computational power.

item.title: The Bahamas lawyers up as the FTX case proceeds in US court and disagreements fester
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Brown Rudnick has worked for the country since March, but the nation's potentially increasing role in the case requires it to register in the United States as a foreign agent.

item.title: 3 reasons why it could be a rocky week for Bitcoin, Ethereum and altcoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: BTC volatility is at a record low, inflows to spot markets remain muted and this week’s economic calendar suggests that volatility is set to rock the crypto market.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried enters not guilty plea for all counts in federal court
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The former FTX CEO faces eight criminal counts in the United States, which could result in 115 years in prison should he be convicted.

item.title: Tribulations and triumphs: The biggest surprises in crypto of 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elizabeth Gail
item.description: 2022 was a challenging year for many crypto companies, but some maintained exemplary performance.

item.title: Blockchain fintech GammaRey signs $320M merger agreement
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: GammaRey said it has nearly $800 million in consumer assets.

item.title: The ‘godfather of crypto’ wants to create a privacy-focused CBDC: Here’s how
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Erhan Kahraman
item.description: David Chaum explained his game plan to create a CBDC that would also be appreciated by the crypto ecosystem in an exclusive interview.

item.title: Bitcoin miners see mixed successes in tackling debt-fueled overexpansion crisis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Industry players accumulated over $4 billion of debt in the last crypto run-up.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's legal team warns of 'harassment and threats' to parents in latest court filing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Two unidentified parties are planning to act as sureties for Sam Bankman-Fried's bail, and his legal team wants to ensure they stay that way.

item.title: Community celebrates Bitcoin Genesis Day by sending BTC to the genesis block
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The wallet address now contains around 68.56 BTC, which is worth around $1.1 million at the time of writing.

item.title: The best (and worst) stories from 3 years of Cointelegraph Magazine
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Fenton

item.title: Bitcoin teases weekly highs as traders eye BTC price leg up to $17.3K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin has the ability to tackle the $17,000 mark for the first time in 2023 should stocks start the year right, say traders.

item.title: Ukrainian pharmacies enable crypto payments via Binance Pay
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Ukraine continues adopting cryptocurrency payments with crypto exchange Binance amid the ongoing war with Russia.

item.title: Lightning Network gets physical form in Australia with Bitcoin ATM
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Lightning-enabled Bitcoin ATMs promise to offer instant transaction support and a significant cut in cost from traditional crypto ATMs.

item.title: Tax attorney breaks down the MicroStrategy Bitcoin sale
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: MicroStrategy’s recent sale of a portion of its Bitcoin treasury holdings puts cryptocurrency tax-loss harvesting into the spotlight.

item.title: Bitcoin volatility may return in ‘catch up’ with gold in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Both stocks and gold are leading the way when it comes to new year gains, but can Bitcoin match them?

item.title: Morocco finalized crypto regulatory framework: Central Bank
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The bill, which should be introduced to public discussion in the following days, will legally define crypto in the fast-growing market.

item.title: Su Zhu gets called out by the community as he fires off accusations against DCG
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The 3AC founder fired off allegations against the Digital Currency Group, saying that it conspired with FTX to attack LUNA.

item.title: Bithumb former chair Lee Jung-Hoon acquitted in the first instance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The former chair was under allegations of $70 million in fraud charges which were said to have occurred during the acquisition of Bithumb.

item.title: Bahamas regulator denies asking crypto exchange FTX to mint new tokens
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.category: U.S House of Financial Services Committee
item.description: Bahamas regulator fights back against being “publicly challenged” by FTX against incorrect calculations of digital assets transferred under its control

item.title: Erik Voorhees tips $40K BTC by June, but little consensus among pundits
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: ShapeShift CEO Erik Voorhees expects Bitcoin to reach $40,000 by the summer, while Tim Draper has stood by his $250,000 prediction for the second year running.

item.title: Ethereum transactions 338% higher in 2022 but Bitcoin remains most popular
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Total transactions on the Ethereum network outstripped Bitcoin more than fourfold, but Bitcoin was still the most searched cryptocurrency of 2022.

item.title: Public filings reveal a $3B crypto trader who still lives with his mom
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: While living at his parent's house in Sydney, Australia, this crypto trader took home over $7 million in profits in 2021, according to public records.

item.title: No ‘respite’ for exploits, flash loans or exit scams in 2023: Cybersecurity firm
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The industry is likely to see “further attempts from hackers targeting bridges in 2023," while users are urged to be warier of their private keys.
